intro: Caenotus, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Campanulaceae. These plants are characterized by their striking, bell-shaped flowers that often display a range of colors, including white, pink, and purple. They are native to various regions in South America, particularly in Brazil and Argentina. Caenotus species typically grow in moist, shaded environments such as forests and riverbanks. Their unique appearance and ecological adaptations make them an interesting subject for botanical study.
